definitions.definition: To cloister , confine , imprison or hole up : to lock someone up or seclude oneself behind walls.
To put or bury within a wall .
examples: John's body was immured Thursday in the mausoleum.

definitions.definition: To trap or capture (an impurity ); chiefly in the participial adjective immured and gerund or gerundial noun immuring .
definitions.label_groups: transitive , crystallography and geology , of a growing crystal

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cloister , confine , imprison or hole up : to lock someone up or seclude oneself behind walls.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To put or bury within a wall .
( transitive , crystallography and geology , of a growing crystal ) To trap or capture (an impurity ); chiefly in the participial adjective immured and gerund or gerundial noun immuring .
